description: Number of ternary Lyndon words of length n with trace 0 and subtrace 0 over GF(3).
comments: Trace is sum of digits, subtrace is sum of products of pairs of digits. [3|n] above is "Iversonian convention", 1 if 3|n, 0 otherwise.
links: F. Ruskey, Ternary Lyndon words of given trace and subtrace over GF(3)
formula: Sum{ d divides n, d==1, 2(3) }mu(d)(M(n/d, 0, 0)-[3d divides n]3^{n/(3d)}), where M(n, t, s) = Sum{ i+j+k=n, j=t(3), k=s(3) }( n!/(i!j!k!) )
author: _Frank Ruskey_, Jan 16 2000
